etymologies: early 17th century: perhaps a transferred use of Old French wivre ‘serpent, dragon’, from Latin vipera ‘viper’

definitions: a small, long-bodied fish with eyes at the top of the head and venomous dorsal spines. It occurs along European Atlantic coasts, typically buried in the sand with just the eyes and spines protruding.

notes.text: Family Trachinidae: several genera and species

shortDefinitions: fish with eyes at top of head and venomous dorsal spines
